TopicTitle: So We Divide By 11 For Earth to Kerbal Scale Eh?

Articles.Content:
Soooo... this has 3 million parts... divide by 11...

So when do we get to build our 272,727 part rockets? (hehe, just kidding). Edited June 8, 2013 by NeoMorph
Well, I know youtube videos, and I don't think that leads anywhere. I mean, I'm no Sherlock Holmes or anything.

10.6

Not 11, not 10... not 10.5... 10.6! (And that isn't accurate enough either... but too lazy to go grab the full number ;p)

*But, if you make a "by the numbers equivalent" I think you'll get 3x more "Mass to Orbit" on Kerbin, so we should be making 1,000,000 part rockets

I wonder how many years it would have taken Apollo to reach the moon if it had to deal with KSP lag. Apollo would probably be a generation ship heh.

Actually, that said, while some people have complained of more lag in 20.x I've got a distinct improvement. So maybe, grandchildren.

I manually piloted a 3,000Mg "Test Launch" for 40min at 1 frame per second (it went perfectly well... and I retired the launcher.)

If you compare how much longer their flights are to "ours", I think you'll say "Thank God I have TimeWarp"

Also, YouTube link is still invalid XD
